chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall n m : nat, m > 0 -> {x : nat | n = power x m} + {p : nat & {q : nat & {r : nat & {k : nat | is_prime p /\ 0 < r /\ r < m /\ n = power p (q * m + r) * k /\ rel_prime p k}}}}

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
rel_prime = fun a b : nat => is_gcd 1 a b : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments rel_prime (_ _)%nat_scope
is_prime = fun p : nat => p <> 1 /\ (forall d : nat, divides p d -> d = 1 \/ d = p) : nat -> Prop Arguments is_prime _%nat_scope
power = fix power (x n : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 1 | S n0 => x * power x n0 end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments power (_ _)%nat_scope
wf_power_dec : forall (n : nat) (l : list (nat * nat)), is_wf l -> n > 0 -> {x : nat | refactor l = power x n} + {p : nat & {q : nat & {r : nat & {k : nat | is_prime p /\ 0 < r /\ r < n /\ refactor l = power p (q * n + r) * k /\ rel_prime p k}}}}
nat_factor_prime : forall n : nat, n <> 0 -> n <> 1 -> {p : nat & {m : nat & {q : nat | is_prime p /\ m > 0 /\ n = power p m * q /\ is_gcd 1 p q /\ q < n}}}
euclide : forall a b : nat, b <> 0 -> {q : nat & {r : nat | a = b * q + r /\ r < b}}
not_prime_impl_prime_divides : forall n : nat, ~ is_prime n -> {p : nat | is_prime p /\ divides n p} + {n = 1}
divides_nat : forall n : nat, {p : nat | p <> 1 /\ p <> n /\ divides n p} + {forall p : nat, p <> 1 -> p <> n -> ~ divides n p}
nat_factor : forall n p : nat, is_prime p -> n <> 0 -> {m : nat | divides n (power p m) /\ ~ divides n (power p (m + 1))}
dec_impl_lt_dec : forall P : nat -> Prop, (forall n : nat, {P n} + {~ P n}) -> forall m : nat, {n : nat | n < m /\ P n} + {forall n : nat, n < m -> ~ P n}
power_lt : forall p m : nat, 1 < p -> 0 < m -> 1 < power p m
bezout_exists : forall a b : nat, {u : nat & {v : nat | is_gcd (a * u - b * v) a b}} + {u : nat & {v : nat | is_gcd (b * v - a * u) a b}}
Init.Nat.mul = fix mul (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S p => m + mul p m end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.mul (_ _)%nat_scope
Fin.to_nat = fix to_nat (m : nat) (n : Fin.t m) {struct n} : {i : nat | i < m} := match n in (Fin.t n0) return {i : nat | i < n0} with | @Fin.F1 j => exist (fun i : nat => i < S j) 0 (Nat.lt_0_succ j) | @Fin.FS n0 p => let (i, P) := to_nat n0 p in exist (fun i0 : nat => i0 < S n0) (S i) (lt_n_S i n0 P) end : forall m : nat, Fin.t m -> {i : nat | i < m} Arguments Fin.to_nat {m}%nat_scope
mult_lt_compat_r : forall n m p : nat, n < m -> 0 < p -> n * p < m * p
divides_prime : forall a : nat, (exists p : nat, p <> a /\ is_prime p /\ divides a p) -> ~ is_prime a
Init.Nat.add = fix add (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S p => S (add p m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.add (_ _)%nat_scope
plus_is_one : forall m n : nat, m + n = 1 -> {m = 0 /\ n = 1} + {m = 1 /\ n = 0}
Init.Nat.sub = fix sub (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => n | S k => match m with | 0 => n | S l => sub k l end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.sub (_ _)%nat_scope
in_wf : forall (l : list (nat * nat)) (p n : nat), In (p, n) l -> is_wf l -> is_prime p /\ n > 0
lt_plus_trans : forall n m p : nat, n < m -> n < m + p
power_plus_lemma1 : forall n m x : nat, power x (n + m) = power x n * power x m
Nat.add_lt_mono_l : forall n m p : nat, n < m < -> p + n < p + m
gt = fun n m : nat => m < n : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments gt (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.lt_trans : forall n m p : nat, n < m -> m < p -> n < p
mult_lemma5 : forall n m : nat, n * m = 1 -> n = 1 /\ m = 1
refactor = fix refactor (l : list (nat * nat)) : nat := match l with | nil => 1 | (p, n) :: tail => power p n * refactor tail end : list (nat * nat) -> nat Arguments refactor _%list_scope
is_cd = fun d a b : nat => divides a d /\ divides b d : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_cd (_ _ _)%nat_scope

```coq
intros n m H.
induction n using wf_nat_ind.
- left. exists 1. auto.
- destruct IHn as [x | [p [q [r [k [Hp [Hr [Hqr [Hnk Hpk]]]]]]]].
  + destruct (euclide m x) as [q' [r' [Hqr']]].
    destruct (Nat.lt_trichotomy r' m) as [Hlt | [Heq | Hgt]].
    * left. exists x. auto.
    * subst r'. right. exists p, q, r, k. auto.
    * right. exists p, q, r, k. auto.
  + destruct (euclide m (power p (q * n + r))) as [q' [r' [Hqr']]].
    destruct (Nat.lt_trichotomy r' m) as [Hlt | [Heq | Hgt]].
    * right. exists p, q, r, k. auto.
    * subst r'. right. exists p, q, r, k. auto.
    * right. exists p, q, r, k. auto.
Qed.```

original: intros n m H. induction n using wf_nat_ind. - left. exists 1. auto. -
